Name: State of small business survey.
Title: A Local Law in relation to a state of small business survey

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was heard but not signed at the November 6, 2017 Mayoral Public Hearing on Proposed Local Laws.

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Nov. 17, 2017 (31st Day).

Summary: This bill requires the Commissioner of Small Business Services to prepare and disseminate a state of small business survey by September 1, 2018, which will collect information from small businesses, including but not limited to, hiring needs, workforce development needs, barriers to growth, and the need for additional tools and resources.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. State of small business survey. a. No later than September 1, 2018, the commissioner of small business services shall prepare and disseminate a state of small business survey, which shall request information from small businesses.
	b. Such information requested shall include, but need not be limited to:
	1. Hiring needs of small businesses;
	2. Workforce development needs and skills necessary to fill small business jobs; 
	3. Issues that small businesses are experiencing, such as barriers to growth; and
	4. The need for additional tools and resources that may assist small business.
	ï¿½ 2.	This local law takes effect immediately.

NKA/SSY
LS#9444/9680
9/19/17 12:50pm
